title: Mini-Course: Asian Art at the Art Institute
short_description: Six-week lecture series with in-gallery seminars
list_description: Six-week lecture series with in-gallery seminars
description:
Six Saturdays, February 17-March 24
11:00-12:30
Ryan Learning Center
$153.65 SAIC Alumni, $184.45 AIC Members, $204.75 Nonmembers

>To register, fill out this form and e-mail to cs@saic.edu, fax to (312) 629-6171, or drop off at 36 S. Wabash Ave, Chicago, IL 60603. Get to know the collection of Asian Art at the Art Institute through lively in-gallery discussions and short lectures led by Annie Morse. This six-week course takes a thematic approach, exploring the arts of the court, religion and ritual, and architecture and domestic life, offering unique insights into the special exhibition, Mirroring China’s Past: Emperors, Scholars, and their Bronzes, on view this spring. This program is offered as a noncredit course within the School of the Art Institute of Chicago’s Adult Continuing Education program.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
